content.html: Once we establish ourselves as a person who would not shy away from saying white lies as long as we get what we want/prevent bad things from happening by telling the truth (which just means you did something that would negatively impact you and/or others if the truth comes out ) then you would notice that even if we get away till now, we are paying a price.

We convince ourselves every time we tell a lie and get away with it that we can do a small thing (a bad thing) and get away with it by lying. What we are essentially doing is manipulating the circumstances and trying to bend reality to serve us in some way or the other!
Manipulating the reality to serve you may seem enticing for now but it is always better to pay the price today than to pay the price with compounded interest tomorrow.
How many times have we heard a story about what happens when a married man cheats on his wife without her knowing for months? It almost always ends with a divorce/breakup in the case of couples.

I have always asked myself why is it? Is that not just a mistake when a person chooses to have a one-night stand with someone else and hides it from his partner? And once she realizes it, later on, she would be hurt by it of course! but would eventually forgive him because the good he has done so far outweighs this one mistake.
Haha! I was just naive to think about it coming to think about it. I did not know one critical point before then.
A lie becomes a betrayal is kept a secret!

This one point changed everything for me! But it still did not explain to me how not telling the truth could be perceived as a lie. The lie of omission is a greater sin than a lie of commission according to Jordan Peterson. It did not make sense to me how that could be so!

It makes sense in a way now coming to think about it! When you miss important information with the full intention of keeping the other person in the dark and thus manipulating the situation, we are manipulating the truth a bit further, stretching the truth a little further and thus it snaps back at us with a higher intensity than the lie of commission because the lie of the commission includes false information in place instead of omitting it completely thus just twisting the truth to serve the person telling the lie, in other words stretching it comparatively a little less than the lie of omission.
How so? I haven’t figured it out, yet! Do let me know if you know.
But the fact remains if you lie you have to pay for it! The longer you keep it as a lie the more you pay for it.
The truth always comes out for those who seek.

Let us say that truth never came out. You got away with it. What happens then? You got away manipulating the truth. So the likely hood of you doing it more in the future increases. Why do people lie? To manipulate the circumstances to serve them. Why would they manipulate the circumstances and then lie about it? Because they would like to have the cake and eat it too!

But the manipulation has forever altered their interaction with reality. So they see the world as something that can be manipulated. So instead of choosing a path, that is very hard but truthful to reach a place they would choose to manipulate reality to serve them and try not to be burnt by the consequences of the manipulation. That is why corruption is bad! That is why stealing is bad! That’s why those who steal also lie. And those who lie also tend to think that others lie to them. And as a matter of fact, choose to think that others lie to them because they are trying to manipulate them into getting something (forcibly taking something valuable from them forever) by manipulation.

This is also why those who lie have trust issues. Although that is not the only reason people have trust issues. You also do not trust someone if you have been hurt by someone thus breaking your heart so much so that it is hard to ever trust someone else.

Let’s say that someone has lied about having a bachelor's degree and then bribed the interviewer with the money that they stole from their parents to get a job that they have no intention of actually putting in the effort necessary. Then they have decided to outsource their work to China and just chill out all day playing PS5 for the next 6 years. And one fine day, the security team finds an unexpected VPN connection from China and digs deeper to find out that you have been outsourcing everything for the past 6 years, so they choose to dig deeper then find out that the degree certificate provided was forged! Moreover, it was the responsibility of the interviewer to find out if the hired person knew necessary before hiring them, so they find out that the interviewer is corrupt and might have been hiring people based on the bribe paid to him. What happens??
You get fired, the interviewer gets fired, you both get black listed and you would be lucky if it ends with black listing!
Manipulation, bribing, and stealing are not meant for truth seekers! Seek the truth, the path may be hard but it will be eternally lasting and never.
